name: NPR
text:
Domestic terrorism analysts warn that Trump's false and reckless claims about the election results are only fueling an "us vs. them" polarization that has reached dangerous levels in the U.S.
https://t.co/HWpPl69Wkj

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden and Kamala Harris have launched a transition website highlighting four policy areas their administration will prioritize:

• the pandemic
• economic recovery
• racial equity
• climate change
https://t.co/Ynrlj5O4s7

name: NPR
text:
While some GOP leaders — like former President George W. Bush and Sen. Mitt Romney — have congratulated President-elect Joe Biden on his victory, others have remained silent, or have continued backing President Trump's false claims of voter fraud.
https://t.co/y32J7quLZt

name: NPR
text:
Doug Emhoff, Kamala Harris' husband, will not only become the first "second gentleman" in U.S. history. He'll also be the first Jewish person married to a president or vice president.
https://t.co/htrVziNh5C

name: NPR
text:
On the day Joe Biden was called as the winner of the presidential election, Saturday Night Live finally delivered a performance that met the moment this season, writes critic Eric Deggans.
https://t.co/jU4TalL8Mz

name: NPR
text:
This election, the faith vote largely broke along familiar lines. White evangelicals still largely backed Trump.

One slight change: a small decline in Trump's support among white Catholics compared to 2016.
https://t.co/UCF4SNc3Wz

name: NPR
text: NPR Music's picks for the best new albums out this week include pure escapism from Kylie Minogue's Disco, the "destructive" pop-rap of Bree Runway, Argentinian bandoneon master Dino Saluzzi and more.  https://t.co/oJyAGkl6UB

name: NPR
text:
In his campaign, Joe Biden proposed the most aggressive plan to tackle climate change of any major party nominee.

But if he doesn't have a Democratic Senate, he'll have his work cut out for him.
https://t.co/1V6PwPlLNw

name: NPR
text: More than 237,000 Americans have died from COVID-19 since the pandemic began, and the 7-day rolling average of new coronavirus cases is now over 110,000 — more than double what it was a month ago. https://t.co/ZHicrdHwls

name: NPR
text:
The world, by way of Texas, lost two of its most iconoclastic, mythologized artists this past month – Jerry Jeff Walker and Billy Joe Shaver.

Critic Charles Aaron breaks down the impact of their work on the wider sound of American music:
https://t.co/VhfOQT3eKS

name: NPR
text:
Though President-elect Joe Biden won't have the benefit of a unified Democratic Congress, environmental activists say he can take executive action on climate change in addition to reversing many of President Trump's executive orders.
https://t.co/YQflr6zQQL

name: NPR
text: Dr. Taison Bell recalls his COVID-19 ICU unit full of patients of color in majority white Charlottesville, Va. "Even if it's not in your community now, it's likely to be in your community later," he said. https://t.co/GMAI9RzyQq

name: NPR
text:
In "Moonbase 8" — a Showtime comedy series about three NASA astronauts-in-training at a mock moonbase in the desert — the jokes are sometimes broad. Sometimes specific. Sometimes dry.

What they aren't very often, critic Glen Weldon writes, is funny.
https://t.co/CK6Gh9HLtF

name: NPR
text:
Meena Kandasamy's new novel is ostensibly about a married couple in London dealing with storms both intimate and geopolitical — but the writer also manages to work her own story into the margins.
 https://t.co/O8ek6VmZcO

name: NPR
text:
Here are five key questions about the potential damage done by President Trump's withdrawal from the World Health Organization — and what the future could hold with a Biden administration.
https://t.co/oiaoj77GrJ

name: NPR
text:
President-elect Biden has named 13 health experts to his Transition COVID-19 Advisory Board.

The panel will be co-chaired by:
• former Surgeon General Vivek Murthy
• former FDA Commissioner Dr. David Kessler
• Dr. Marcella Nunez-Smith of Yale
https://t.co/BHhdY8kqx3

name: NPR
text:
Pfizer's experimental COVID-19 vaccine was found to be more than 90% effective, according to clinical results released by the company Monday — making it the first to have data showing that it exceeded the minimum threshold set by the FDA for emergency use.
https://t.co/x8NxMIwyQY

name: NPR
text:
RT @NPRGoatsandSoda: Even under a Biden administration, experts say the U.S. is unlikely to play the same role it once did on the global health stage -- and the last four years have shown the world that the U.S. can be an unreliable ally on global health.

text:

"It's not going to be someone who looks like Gavin," an adviser says.

text:

text:

text:

name: NPR
text:
Utah Gov. Gary Herbert has announced a new statewide mask mandate amid a steep spike in coronavirus cases in the state.

Casual social gatherings will only permitted among people who live in the same household for the next 2 weeks.
